page.title: 05CADEBY ARCHITECTURE
page.content:
Several properties have undergone extensive renovation, a particular example being Church Farm, a l6th /17th century, two storey, timber framed farmhouse with outbuildings, which although previously neglected is now restored to pristine condition. Directly opposite the Church stands Jasmine Cottage, built in 1865 as the schoolroom, it continued as such until the 1940's when the school closed and the cottage was adapted for residential occupation. Church Cottage is a fine example of mediaeval architecture.
The more modern properties of Cadeby are mainly of bungalow configuration, the most interesting of which is generally held to be Wilderness House, with its unusual flat roofed structure and tree screened frontage.
